thread.title: January London weather map shows bleakest possible start to 2024
thread.title_full: January London weather map shows bleakest possible start to 2024 - MyLondon

author: Will Twigger
title: January London weather map shows bleakest possible start to 2024
text:
New weather maps for early January show serious rain clouds rolling in over London - and most of the country - for a couple of days.
New Year's Day and January 2 look to be sodden and grim. January 1 sees rainfall up and down the country, London not excluded, while the following day looks to be just as grim for the south of the country.
But it's not all doom and gloom, as WXCharts' January 3 map sees the rain clouds move on, and give us more of the classic January gloom rather than the soaking wet.
READ MORE: New London weather map shows blanket of snow for 4 whole days in January
London looks to be in the midst of a sweep on rain clouds across the UK BBC Weather agrees, forecasting heavy rain and a breeze on January 1, while every day after until January 8 will also be wet.
Meanwhile, the Met Office predicts a possible plunge in temperatures later into the month.
January 2 doesn't look much better for the capital Their long range forecast for January 12 - 26 reckons that 'there is an increased chance of colder than average conditions during this period, and a reduced chance of prolonged periods of very unsettled / milder conditions with frequent rain and wind pushing in from the Atlantic.'
It does add that the chance of widespread severe cold is still low, but higher than usual.
The Met Office also reckons that the rain will be considerably lighter on New Year's Day that either the BBC or WXCharts, so here's hoping!
